domains.description:
This domain exposes DOM read/write operations. Each DOM Node is represented with its mirror object that has an id. This id can be used to get additional information on the Node, resolve it into the JavaScript object wrapper, etc. It is important that client receives DOM events only for the nodes that are known to the client. Backend keeps track of the nodes that were sent to the client and never sends the same node twice. It is client's responsibility to collect information about the nodes that were sent to the client.

Note that iframe owner elements will return corresponding document elements as their child nodes.

types.description: Unique DOM node identifier used to reference a node that may not have been pushed to the front-end.
Backend node with a friendly name.

properties.name: nodeId
properties.description: Node identifier that is passed into the rest of the DOM messages as the nodeId. Backend will only push node with given id once. It is aware of all requested nodes and will only fire DOM events for nodes known to the client.

domains.description: This domain exposes CSS read/write operations. All CSS objects (stylesheets, rules, and styles) have an associated id used in subsequent operations on the related object. Each object type has a specific id structure, and those are not interchangeable between objects of different kinds. CSS objects can be loaded using the get*ForNode() calls (which accept a DOM node id). A client can also discover all the existing stylesheets with the getAllStyleSheets() method (or keeping track of the styleSheetAdded/styleSheetRemoved events) and subsequently load the required stylesheet contents using the getStyleSheet[Text]() methods.

types.description: Stylesheet type: "injected" for stylesheets injected via extension, "user-agent" for user-agent stylesheets, "inspector" for stylesheets created by the inspector (i.e. those holding the "via inspector" rules), "regular" for regular stylesheets.

properties.description: Matches of CSS rules applicable to the pseudo style.

types.description: CSS rule collection for a single pseudo style.

properties.name: inlineStyle
properties.description: The ancestor node's inline style, if any, in the style inheritance chain.

properties.name: matchedCSSRules
properties.description: Matches of CSS rules matching the ancestor node in the style inheritance chain.

types.description: Inherited CSS rule collection from ancestor node.

properties.name: matchingSelectors
properties.description: Matching selector indices in the rule's selectorList selectors (0-based).

types.description: Match data for a CSS rule.

properties.name: range
properties.description: Value range in the underlying resource (if available).

types.description: Data for a simple selector (these are delimited by commas in a selector list).

properties.name: sourceMapURL

properties.name: ownerNode
properties.description: The backend id for the owner node of the stylesheet.

properties.name: disabled

properties.name: isInline
properties.description: Whether this stylesheet is created for STYLE tag by parser. This flag is not set for document.written STYLE tags.

properties.name: startLine
properties.description: Line offset of the stylesheet within the resource (zero based).

properties.name: startColumn
properties.description: Column offset of the stylesheet within the resource (zero based).

properties.name: styleSheetId
properties.description: The css style sheet identifier (absent for user agent stylesheet and user-specified stylesheet rules) this rule came from.

properties.name: media
properties.description: Media list array (for rules involving media queries). The array enumerates media queries starting with the innermost one, going outwards.

types.description: Text range within a resource. All numbers are zero-based.

properties.name: important
properties.description: Whether the property has "!important" annotation (implies false if absent).

properties.name: styleSheetId
properties.description: The css style sheet identifier (absent for user agent stylesheet and user-specified stylesheet rules) this rule came from.

properties.name: shorthandEntries
properties.description: Computed values for all shorthands found in the style.

properties.name: range
properties.description: Style declaration range in the enclosing stylesheet (if available).

properties.name: important
properties.description: Whether the property has "!important" annotation (implies false if absent).

properties.name: implicit

properties.name: text
properties.description: The full property text as specified in the style.

properties.name: parsedOk
properties.description: Whether the property is understood by the browser (implies true if absent).

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: Whether the property is disabled by the user (present for source-based properties only).

properties.name: range
properties.description: The entire property range in the enclosing style declaration (if available).

properties.name: source
properties.description: Source of the media query: "mediaRule" if specified by a @media rule, "importRule" if specified by an @import rule, "linkedSheet" if specified by a "media" attribute in a linked stylesheet's LINK tag, "inlineSheet" if specified by a "media" attribute in an inline stylesheet's STYLE tag.

properties.name: sourceURL

parameters.description: The browser context to create the page in (headless chrome only).

returns.name: targetId
returns.description: The id of the page opened.

commands.name: closeTarget
commands.description: Closes the target. If the target is a page that gets closed too.

commands.name: getTargets
commands.description: Returns target information for all potential targets.

commands.name: attach
commands.description: Attaches to the target with given id.

parameters.name: targetId
parameters.description: Target id.

commands.name: detach
commands.description: Detaches from the target with given id.

commands.name: sendMessage
commands.description: Sends protocol message to the target with given id.

events.name: dispatchMessage

domains.description: The SystemInfo domain defines methods and events for querying low-level system information.

properties.name: vendorId
properties.description: PCI ID of the GPU vendor, if available; 0 otherwise.

properties.name: deviceId
properties.description: PCI ID of the GPU device, if available; 0 otherwise.

properties.name: vendorString
properties.description: String description of the GPU vendor, if the PCI ID is not available.

properties.name: deviceString
properties.description: String description of the GPU device, if the PCI ID is not available.

properties.name: devices
properties.description: The graphics devices on the system. Element 0 is the primary GPU.

properties.name: auxAttributes
properties.description: An optional dictionary of additional GPU related attributes.

properties.name: featureStatus
properties.description: An optional dictionary of graphics features and their status.

properties.name: driverBugWorkarounds
properties.description: An optional array of GPU driver bug workarounds.

types.description: Provides information about the GPU(s) on the system.

commands.name: getInfo
commands.description: Returns information about the system.

returns.name: gpu
returns.description: Information about the GPUs on the system.

returns.name: modelName
returns.description: A platform-dependent description of the model of the machine. On Mac OS, this is, for example, 'MacBookPro'. Will be the empty string if not supported.

returns.name: modelVersion
returns.description: A platform-dependent description of the version of the machine. On Mac OS, this is, for example, '10.1'. Will be the empty string if not supported.

domains.description: The Tethering domain defines methods and events for browser port binding.

commands.name: bind
commands.description: Request browser port binding.

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: Port number to bind.

commands.name: unbind
commands.description: Request browser port unbinding.

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: Port number to unbind.

events.name: accepted
events.description: Informs that port was successfully bound and got a specified connection id.

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: Port number that was successfully bound.

parameters.name: connectionId
parameters.description: Connection id to be used.
